derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin, literally single', variant of simplus 'simple'

means.word_mean: 1. allowing communication in only one direction at a time, or in telegraphy allowing only one message over a line at a time;
2. having only one part or element;

sentences.sentence: "a simplex word has no affixes and is not part of a compound--like `boy' compared with `boyish' or `house' compared with `houseboat'"
